intro: Gagea amblyopetala var. heldreichii, commonly known as the Heldreich's gagea, is a perennial bulbous plant native to the mountainous regions of the Balkans. It features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, white to pale pink flowers arranged in a dense cluster. The plant is characterized by its compact growth habit and is often found in rocky or dry habitats. It belongs to the family Liliaceae and is adapted to thrive in temperate climates with well-drained soils. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
